events.description: 3/15/2011 16:00:00 - Confirmed closed - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-small and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. 3/16/2011 1:55:00 - Operated to Open - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-small and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. (Reactor 3)

events.name: Confirmed S/C valve closed - Unable to keep open
events.description: Confirmed closed - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. (Reactor 3)

events.name: Confirmed S/C valve closed - Unable to keep open
events.description: 21:00:00 - Confirmed closed - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. 21:30:00 - Operated to open - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. (Reactor 3)

events.name: Confirmed S/C valve closed - Unable to keep open
events.description: 5:30:00 - Confirmed closed - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. 5:30:00 - Operated to open - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. (Reactor 3)

events.name: Attempted to open S/C valve several times - Unable to keep open
events.description: 11:25:00 - Confirmed closed - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. 11:30:00 - Operated to open - After this, because of loss of air pressure for S/C vent valve (AO valve)-large and loss of excitation of the solenoid at the air supply line, we couldnâ€t maintain the S/C vent valve open. Several times we operated the valve to open. (Reactor 3)

events.name: Installed temporary lights in MCR
events.description: Temporary lights were installed in MCR of Unit 3/4 (Reactor 3, Reactor 4)

events.name: AC Power Lost
events.description: All AC electric power supply was lost in Reactor 4 (Reactor 4)

events.name: Reactor 4 SFP was confirmed to be 84 C
events.description: Temperature in spent fuel pool of Reactor 4 was confirmed to be 84 Celsius (Reactor 4)

events.name: Explosion
events.description: Explosive sound was confirmed. Later, damage to the roof of reactor buildingâ€s 5th floor in Reactor 4 was confirmed (Reactor 4)

events.name: Damage to Reactor 4 Building 5th floor reported to authorities
events.description: Damage to the roof of reactor building 5th floor in Reactor 4 was reported to government offices etc. (Reactor 4)

events.name: Confirmed damage to reactor building of Reactor 4 - Radiation dose measured - 807 ÎŒSv /h
events.description: Damage to reactor building in Reactor 4 was confirmed. Also, as the radiation dose exceeded 500ÎŒSv/h (807ÎŒSv/h) around the main gate, it was determined that a specific incident stipulated in article 15, clause 1 of Act on Special Measures Concerning Nuclear Emergency Preparedness (Extraordinary release of radiation materials caused by fire explosion) occurred and it was reported to the government offices etc. at 8:36 am. As radioactive dose exceeding 500ÎŒSv/h(807ÎŒSv /h) was measured by monitoring post, it was judged to specific issue (radioactive materials abnormally released due to fire disaster and explosion) based on Article15, clause1 of Act on Special Measures Concerning Nuclear Emergency Preparedness occurred, and reported to the authorities at 8:36am. At 8:25 am, confirmed white smoke (seems steam) rising out from the wall around 5th floor of Reactor Building, reported to the authorities at 9:18pm. (Reactor 4)

events.name: Confirmed fire around north west part of 3rd floor
events.description: Fire was confirmed around north west part of 3rd floor in reactor building of Reactor 4. It was reported to the government offices etc. at 9:38 am. (Reactor 4)

events.name: Confirmed fire had ceased
events.description: TEPCO staff confirmed that the fire at reactor building of Reactor 4 was off. It was reported to government offices etc. at 11:45 am. (Reactor 4)

events.name: Reactor 5 - EDG's activated
events.description: Emergency diesel generator (hereinafter called DG) activated automatically in Reactor 5 3 DG activated automatically at Reactor 6 (Reactor 5)

events.name: Reduce RPV pressure
events.description: Pressure in reactor pressure vessel was reduced by opening a valve on the top in Reactor 5. (Reactor 5)

events.name: Restored EDGs to Reactor 5
events.description: Power became available from DG in Reactor 5 and 6 (Reactor 5)

events.name: Water injection by condenser pump initiated at Reactor 5
events.description: Water injection by condenser pump powered by DG was initiated in Unit5 (continued intermittently) (Reactor 5)

events.name: AC Power Lost
events.description: All AC electric power supply was lost in Reactor 5 (Reactor 5)

events.name: Reactor 6 - EDG's activated
events.description: Emergency diesel generator (hereinafter called DG) activated automatically in Reactor 5 3 DG activated automatically at Reactor 6 (Reactor 6)

events.name: Reactor 6 EDGs tripped
events.description: 2 DG in Reactor 6 tripped (Reactor 6)

events.name: Restored EDGs to Reactor 6
events.description: Power became available from DG in Reactor 5 and 6 (Reactor 6)

events.name: Water by EDG-powered condenser pump initiated
events.description: Water injection by condenser pump powered by DG was initiated in Unit6 (continued intermittently) (Reactor 6)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Judged that specific issue (lost all AC power sources) based on the article 10, clause 1 of Act on Special Measures Concerning Nuclear Emergency Preparedness occurred and reported to authority etc. It was determined that a specific incident stipulated in article 10, clause 1 of Act on Special Measures Concerning Nuclear Emergency Preparedness (loss of all AC electric supply) occurred and it was informed to the government offices etc. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: The relevant governments were notified of the incident - ECCS Impossible - Reactor water level and status of water injection not confirmed (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: The relevant governments were notified of the cancellation of (impossibility of water injection by Emergency Core Cooling System) (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: The relevant governments were notified of the cancellation of (impossibility of water injection by Emergency Core Cooling System) (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Reported TAF reaching time to authority
events.description: Estimated the TAF reaching time at 9:40 pm, report it to authority. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported water levels at TAF +3400 (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported to the authorities as a result of survey at 11:40 pm, an increase of radioactive dose in the turbine building (1.2mSv/h in front of the double doors in the North on the first floor of the turbine building, 0.5mSv/h in front of the double doors in the South on the first floor of the turbine building) (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported (extraordinary increase of pressure in the Primary Containment Vessel) to the authorities at 0:55 am (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Reported D/W pressure reached 840kPa abs at 2:30 am to authorities
events.description: Reported to the authorities, D/W pressure reached 840 kPa abs at 2:30 am (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported to the authorities, the result of evaluation of radioactive exposure in the case that the Vent was implemented at Reactor 1 and Reactor 2. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: It was informed to the government offices etc. that the (radiation dose at the border of the site increased extraordinary) (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Radioactive material leakage confirmed and reported
events.description: As the radioactive dose increased in the premise of the power plant and the D/W pressure tended to decrease, it was judged that â€radioactive material leakage to the exteriorâ€? occurred. Reported it to the authorities. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported to the authorities, an evaluation result of exposure in the case that the Vent was implemented. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Reported radiation exposure of TEPCO employee exceeded 100 mSv
events.description: Reported to the authorities, that radioactive exposure of an employee of Tepco exceeded 100 mSv (106.30 mSv), who had entered into the reactor building for the Vent operation (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Reported release of radioactive substances to authorities
events.description: At 2:30 PM, we confirmed that D/W pressure went down and determined this as â€release of radioactive substancesâ€? by Vent. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported the following items to the authorities: recovery work of standby liquid control system was in progress, the standby liquid control pump was scheduled to be activated and boric-acid solution was be injected into the reactor through the Fire Protection Line as soon as that was be injected into the reactor through the Fire Protection Line as soon as that was ready. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: The information was shared among the head office and the power station that there was an order of The Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry based on the laws and ordinances. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Press release of implementation of the vent
events.description: At 5:50 AM we made the press release regarding Vent. (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Informed government water levels reached top of active fuel
events.description: informed to the government offices etc ater level reached to the top of active fuel (hereinafter called â€TAFâ€?) at 4:15 am (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities

events.name: Notified Authorities

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Informed government offices that injection of water to the Reactor 3 through fire extinction system will be implemented (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: Notified Authorities

events.name: Notified Authorities
events.description: Reported radioactive dose raised Radiation dose measured - 905ÎŒSv /h to authorities. Reported (radioactive dose at boundary abnormally raise) based on Article15, clause1 of Act on Special Measures Concerning Nuclear Emergency Preparedness occurred to the authorities (Reported to Authorities)

events.name: First tsunami hit
events.description: 1st seismic sea wave arrived - The tsunami caused a number of nuclear accidents, primarily the ongoing level 7 meltdowns at three reactors in the Fukushima I Nuclear Power Plant complex, and the associated evacuation zones affecting hundreds of thousands of residents. Many electrical generators were taken down, and at least three nuclear reactors suffered explosions due to hydrogen gas that had built up within their outer containment buildings after cooling system failure. Residents within a 20 km (12 mi) radius of the Fukushima I Nuclear Power Plant and a 10 km (6.2 mi) radius of the Fukushima II Nuclear Power Plant were evacuated. In addition, the U.S. recommended that its citizens evacuate up to 80 km (50 mi) of the plant. (Tsunami)

events.name: Second tsunami hit
events.description: 2nd seismic sea wave arrived - The tsunami warning issued by the Japan Meteorological Agency was the most serious on its warning scale; it rated as a "major tsunami", being at least 3 m (9.8 ft) high. The actual height predicted varied, the greatest being for Miyagi at 6 m (20 ft) high. The tsunami inundated a total area of approximately 561 km2 (217 sq mi) in Japan. (Tsunami)
